raw_mentions:
In other embodiments, it was demonstrated that CN19o potency was improved by over 100 fold with an IC50 of less than 1 nM. 
In addition, CN19o (SEQ ID NO: 24) demonstrated about 50,000 fold selectivity of inhibition of CaMKII over CaMKI with no specific metric value mentioned but related to the previous sentence.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

In FIG. 1C, CN21a specificity was tested on a panel of different kinases (at 5 μM, 50-fold IC50).
Kinase assays were done in presence of 0.1 or 0.5 μM CN21 with 80 μM syntide2 as the principle substrate; 
Standard kinase assays were performed with 10 nM CaMKII, 1 μM CaM, and varying concentrations of AC2 (40, 13.33, 8, and 5 μM) and CN21 (0, 0.3, 0.6, and 0.9 μM).

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

Phosphorylation of syntide 2 by CaMKII was inhibited by CN21, CN20 and CN19 with an IC50 of ˜100 nM (FIG. 15D).
CN21a (5 μM) blocks CaMKII phosphorylation of (FIG. 14A) crude live protein extracts, (FIG. 14B) bacterially expressed GST-NR2B-c (containing C-terminal NR2B amino acid 1,120 to 1,482), and (FIG. 14C) T305 but not T286 autophosphorylation.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

However, the single mutant 14A has even higher potency, with an IC50 in the single digit nM range.
FIG. 21C represents that an a2 mutant has higher potency than the a3 mutant (predicted from FIG. 20), as it shows significant inhibition even at 10 nM (in contrast to a3; see panel B).

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

1. It was demonstrated that CN19a2v had an IC50 of ˜20 nM (FIG. 23B); the potency of CN19a2v was about 5-fold greater than CN19 (see FIG. 17A).
2. The V12Q and V16D mutants of CN19a2v had an IC50 of about 1 nM, and a combination mutant (referred to as CN19o) increased potency even further (FIG. 24C).
3. CN19o (SEQ ID NO: 24) inhibited CaMKII with an IC50 of about 0.75 nM (FIG. 25A), and thus CN19o (SEQ ID NO: 24) has >125fold enhanced potency compared to CN19.
4. Further investigation revealed that CaMKI inhibition by CN19o (SEQ ID NO: 24) (about 38 μM IC50) was reduced compared to CN19a2v (about 18 μM IC50).
5. The IC50 for CaMKI inhibition of CN19 (36 μM), CN19a2v (18 μM) and CN19o (38 μM) 360-50,000-fold greater than their IC50 for CaMKII inhibition (100 nM, 20 nM and 0.75 nM, respectively; compare FIGS. 15, 23 and 26).

final_json.molecule_name: V12Q and V16D mutants of CN19a2v
